data.title: Pranjal Chalise - Peer Career Advisor at Amherst College | The Org
data.snippet:
# Pranjal Chalise

### Peer Career Advisor

Pranjal Chalise is a Software Engineer at Microsoft since June 2025, specializing in CoreAI. Concurrently, Pranjal serves as a Peer Career Advisor and a Peer Tutor in both the Math and Computer Science Departments at Amherst College, providing support for students in academic and professional development. Pranjal's prior experience includes working as an AI/ML Fellow and Software Engineer at Microsoft in 2024, and holding various roles at Amherst College such as Math & Stats Student Steering Committee Fellow and IT Specialist. Additionally, Pranjal contributed as a Research Assistant and Research Scholar at Incubate Nepal and is pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science and Mathematics at Amherst College, expected to graduate in May 2026. [...] Log inSign up

 Theater & Dance [...] Amherst offers the Bachelor of Arts degree in 43 majors in the arts, sciences, social sciences, and humanities. Students can carry more than one major or create their own interdisciplinary major. Many students delve more deeply into their major field by undertaking honors theses as seniors. Often the equivalent of graduate-level work, theses have taken the form of a major paper, scientific investigation, or creative work. Departmental and program majors are offered in the following areas:

## Amherst College Majors [...] ### Other Courses and Programs

Amherst participates in a variety of Five College programs, including 11 certificate programs, supervised independent and mentored language programs, and two shared departments.

Additionally, Amherst offers various colloquia and seminars, including first-year seminars.
